alert.note: Alert for Lower Garfield and Asotin Counties (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 17 at 7:31AM PST until January 18 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...INCREASING SNOW INTO THE AFTERNOON... .A weather system will spread increasing snow into the region today. The snow will become heavy in the Cascades, eastern third of Washington, and the Idaho Panhandle with snow rates of near an inch per hour expected. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Patchy blowing and drifting snow. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 7 inches with the highest accumulations above 2000 feet. Snow may mix with rain late Wednesday afternoon and evening. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Alpowa Summit, Pomeroy, Clarkston, Gifford, Lewiston Grade, Peck, Culdesac, Lewiston, and Lapwai. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. In Idaho, for the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1. In Washington, for the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
